subject: Running Junit in Weblogic servers

messageBody:
I am attempting to use Junit to test weblogic application server classes.
The classes themselves rely on weblogic transaction pooling etc.

The classes are NOT EJB's. EJB's exist in a higher layer but would only
exercise part of the functionality of the lower level data acces objects, as
the EJB's are being used for Read Only access to the db.

Is it possible to run Junit on the server, e.g. would wrapping the test
classes as beans work and how would I achieve this and is it worth the
effort?

If this would not work is there any other route to test these classes in
weblogic without writing additional wrapper classes.
